units.title: CellPhoneDB analysis
units.text: develop CellPhoneDB v.3.0 to measure intercellular communica- tion taking into account spatial coordinates of cells and use this tool to define cell signaling in both lumenal and glandular epi- thelial microenvironments.
units.rationale: Describes the computational step for measuring cell‑cell communication.

units.title: Generate uterine cell map
units.text: We were able to generate a uterine map of 98,568 cells from 15 individuals by integrating our dataset with previous scRNA-seq data obtained from superficial endometrial biopsies22 (Fig. 1b, Extended Data Fig. 1b–f and Supplementary Table 2).
units.rationale: Details the creation of a comprehensive single‑cell atlas.

units.title: smFISH validation
units.text: Single-molecule fluorescence in situ hybridization (smFISH) with RNAscope probes shows higher expression of the proliferative marker MKI67 in the superficial layer of the endometrium during the proliferative phase, validating Visium data (Extended Data
units.rationale: Provides an experimental validation step using smFISH.

units.title: Cell2location integration
units.text: computational integration of coupled single-cell transcriptomics and Visium data using our recently developed cell2location algorithm
units.rationale: Specifies the integration method linking scRNA‑seq and spatial data.

units.title: Immune subclustering
units.text: Subclustering of immune cells resolves their heterogeneity, including identification of the three uterine natural
units.rationale: Outlines the subclustering procedure for immune cell heterogeneity.

units.title: Epithelial classification
units.text: Epithelial cells are classified into four main groups based on their marker expression: (1) SOX9+ proliferative, (2) ciliated, (3) lumenal, and (4) glandular
units.rationale: Defines the categorization of epithelial cell types.

units.title: Organoid pathway modulation
units.text: by modulating WNT and NOTCH pathways in the organoid cultures, we develop lineage-specific endometrial epithelial cells
units.rationale: Describes experimental manipulation of signaling pathways in organoids.

units.title: Define SOX9 spatial coordinates
units.text: Two different types of samples from ... define specific spatial coordinates for these SOX9 subsets: (1) noncycling SOX9+LGR5+ cells are enriched in the surface epithelium; (2) noncycling SOX9+LGR5− cells are located in the basal glands; and (3) cycling SOX9+ cells map to glands in the regenerating superficial layer.
units.rationale: Specifies how spatial locations of SOX9 subsets were assigned.

units.title: Integration of scRNA‑seq and snRNA‑seq with spatial data
units.text: By integrating scRNA-seq and Visium data (Fig. 2e and Extended Data Fig. 4c), and Genomics Visium slides and high-resolution microscopy) (Fig. 1a
units.rationale: Summarizes the multi‑modal data integration workflow.
